    Global temperature anomaly data (OWID)

    Source: R/temp_data.R
    temp_data.Rd

    Annual mean near-surface temperature anomaly (°C) relative to the 1861–1890 baseline. A subset (e.g., Australia and World) is included for use in the package and the Shiny app.

    Usage

    temp_data

    Format

    A data frame with columns:

    country

    Character. Entity name (e.g., "Australia", "World").

    year

    Integer. Observation year.

    temp_anomaly

    Numeric. Temperature anomaly in °C relative to 1861–1890.

    Source

    Our World in Data, “Annual temperature anomalies relative to the pre-industrial period” (Met Office Hadley Centre – HadCRUT5). https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/temperature-anomaly

    Details

    The dataset is prepared from the OWID “temperature-anomaly” CSV in data-raw/ using data-raw/build_data.R. The cleaned object is saved to data/temp_data.rda and exposed as temp_data.
